channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Daisy Bank Road is a disgrace, chunks of tarmac damage and height drops all the way up tot he car park. I have now lived here for nearly 3 years and nothing has been done about it despite the reporting of the issue. I pay over £300 a month for my CT and am not seeing any value for that let alone a pride in the area covered!! To put it into perspective moving from London where my CT was £85 a month there was far better upkeep and modernising of the area near me., 1st April
item.description:
Entrance to Daisy Bak Road from Leckhampton Hill all the way up to the UnderScar property past both car parks. Stop ignoring the residents here!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daisybank Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Area like a magnet for filth, 1st April
item.description:
Comes, shopping trolleys, lots of general wrappers and bottles. This area seems to get this this within weeks of when it was last cleaned

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Gristmill Close, Springbank, Cheltenham

item.title: Obscured zig zag and other yellow lines, 31st March
item.description:

item.title: Potholes, 31st March
item.description:
This case has been closed, but that is not acceptable. These are continuing to deteriorate and are a real hazard for children cycling especially. To say they only need attention once they have caused damage to a vehicle is ridiculously reactive.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Aysgarth Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road at the top of Harp Hill close to junction with Birdlip Rd is badly degraded, 31st March
item.description:
Recent patch repairs at the top of Harp Hill close to Birdlip Road junction have been made recently but sections in between the repairs of badly degraded road surface have been left untouched. The road surface is very uneven and a more comprehensive repair is required.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet more flytipping, 31st March
item.description:
Between 1;00 pm Sunday and 8;00 am Monday at single mattress and 2 pieces of furniture have been dumped in the usual spot on the corner of Pates Avenue & Alstone Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Alstone Lane, Alstone, Cheltenham
